instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2327: What is 820-2327? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  quick  ask
threads.message: Hi guys can I use a 30k res in 22k res  <SIGNAL>MCP_VID</SIGNAL><0>  out  to GND    this line come from MCP 39 or <CHIP>U1400</CHIP>  I fix this from water damage some  res and cap lost I m put back but I dont have  22k  just 30k but a no sure if i can use in this case... thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  quick  ask
threads.message: I have no idea, one way to find out. This looks like a basic termination resistor to keep reflections out of the signal, on something that regulates mcp vcore... yeah i wouldn't fuck with that. just find 22k.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  quick  ask
threads.message: After I check everything run ok I found My usb front port fuck has power no broken line no aparente damage J4600  I follow the lines to <CHIP>U4650</CHIP> this look like briged to smc debug mode i test the line pin 9 <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> pin 10 <SIGNAL>USB_DEBUGPRT_EN_L</SIGNAL> as power,  that mean SEL=1 Choose USB s be work fine but no,  any suggest ( other  test j4600 pin1  5v pin2  3.33v pin3  3.32 v p4 gnd  test p2,p3 = 0v look like they get some V front other place I did test the Other port was diferent  p1 5v p2 0v p3 0v p4 gnd)     any help is welcome  thank's

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  quick  ask
threads.message:
Diode mode measurement on both data pins of USB connector?
You could remove <CHIP>U4650</CHIP> and short <RESISTOR>R4651</RESISTOR>/52 to eliminate issue with debug MUX.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  quick  ask
threads.message: j4610  (good one)  Diode mode measurement on both data pins of USB connector? =  .931   j4600 (bad one)  1.630

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  quick  ask
threads.message: j4610 (good one) Diode mode measurement on both data pins of USB connector? = .931 j4600 (bad one) 1.630

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  quick  ask
threads.message: Both data pins are 1630 with positive to GND?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  quick  ask
threads.message:
j4600  pin 2,3  data pin  1.660   between  both of them,        Gnd to   pin 2, 1.265 pin 3 1.268    positive to  gnd    pin 2   0.555    pin 3    0.548           bad one 

j4610  pin 2,3  data pin  0.921   between  both of them,        Gnd to   pin 2,  0.524 pin 3  0.523   positive to  gnd    pin 2   0.545    pin 3    0.545          good one
